archimate:Device.name: High-Performance Laptops (HPL)
archimate:Device.documentation:
Intended Use:
Medical imaging, radiology image review (PACS), laboratory data processing, analytics and AI-driven diagnostic applications.
Specifications:
• Processor type: Intel Core i7/i9 or AMD Ryzen 7/9 • Memory capacity: 64 GB RAM minimum. In addition, more GPU VRAM (12GB+ Recommended) – Some PACS, AI-driven image analysis, and deep learning models benefit from at least 12GB VRAM (e.g., NVIDIA RTX A-series or 40-series). • ECC RAM: ( for Advanced Medical Computing) – If running critical AI workloads, ECC (Error-Correcting Code) RAM improves data integrity. • Storage capacity: 1 TB SSD (NVMe recommended) • Screen size and resolution: 15–17 inches, 4K Ultra HD (3840 x 2160), high brightness, color accuracy. HDR & DICOM Calibration Display • Battery life: Extended Battery Life ( 10+ Hours for Portability) – If laptops are frequently used away from a dock, consider higher capacity batteries. • Operating system: Windows 11 Pro (Healthcare Ready version preferred) • Connectivity options: Wi-Fi 6 (ensure compliance with access points)E, Bluetooth 5.2, Ethernet (via adapter and dock), LTE/5G • Ports and expansion slots: USB-A (x3), USB-C (Thunderbolt 4), HDMI 2.1, DisplayPort via USB-C, SD Card reader, Ethernet • Graphics capabilities: Dedicated graphics (e.g., NVIDIA RTX series or equivalent). At least 8gb of memory • Build quality and weight: High durability, professional-grade aluminum or magnesium alloy build, under 6 lbs. • Protective Equipment: Reinforced laptop carrying case and keyboard protector • Included peripherals: Mouse and Keyboard
• Security Features:
o RFID or biometric authentication for secure login/logout o Privacy screen filter integrated or attached o Remote management and location tracking capability o TPM 2.0 security module for encryption of patient data o Compliant with HIPAA and relevant data security standards.
